data.title: enet fails building on Windows, Android, iOS (missing enet/unix.h)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Current master branch.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
See travis build report: https://travis-ci.org/godotengine/godot/builds/152330609

```
In file included from modules/enet/networked_multiplayer_enet.h:5:0,
                 from modules/enet/networked_multiplayer_enet.cpp:1:
modules/enet/enet/enet.h:18:23: fatal error: enet/unix.h: No such file or directory
 #include "enet/unix.h"
                       ^
```

data.title: Cannot load resource from SpriteFrames window
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint 17.2
Godot 2.1 branch

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When trying to load resources in the SpirteFrames window for an AnimatedSprite node, the dialog for the load resources does not open.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create an AnimatedSprite node
- Select `<SpriteFrame>` in the Frames category under the Inspector
- Open the `SpriteFrames` window and click the `Load Resource` button (nothing should happen which is not desired).
  ![godot_issue_spriteframe](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5597089/17652407/34ebc946-6230-11e6-8cdf-0052f2b46ac4.png)

data.title: Tricky name on Font Import option
data.body:
Hi.

In the Font Import Panel there is an option named "Disable Filter" that has to be 'On' if we want to import the bitmap font without filter and 'Off' if we want it with filter. Wouldn't be easier to just name the option "Filter" or "Use Filter" (as in DynamicFonts) an have it 'On' or 'Off' if we want to use filter or not? What you guys think?

![font_import](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6760623/17652091/fe78f2b4-6241-11e6-9259-38aeed21ba0c.png)

data.title: Don't use absolute paths in imported resources
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

I broke again my project because I moved it to another folder, but mesh resources are pointing to an absolute path. I can see that when hovering the red cross in the File Explorer.
It also seems to be the case for sounds. I remember seeing an issue about this, but wasn't able to find it.

data.title: Could add node with same name under same tree node
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64bit - Godot_v2.1-stable_win64.exe

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can create nodes with same name under same tree node.
![same_named_node](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/17649106/dbf8d576-622b-11e6-948f-d7ab3c26be05.png)
As expected I can't edit or delete the node in game scene.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create scene game
Create scene player **without** camera2d
add instanced player scene to game
select player scene and add camera2d
open player scene add camera2d

You only can see the problem when checkbox **Editable Children** is selected.
![same_named_node_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/17652294/fe3178ee-6278-11e6-8d3b-c1f25cec95bf.png)

I don't know if its a bug or not, but it was confusing when editor tells you, you can't delete the node. :smile: 

Bug Project: [http://www.file-upload.net/download-11850356/same_name_bug.zip.html](http://www.file-upload.net/download-11850356/same_name_bug.zip.html)

data.title: All inclusive 'undo'
data.body:
Linux Ubuntu 16.04.1 x86_64 running MATE desktop.
Godot version "Godot_v2.1-stable_x11.64"

Apparently not everything we can do in the editor goes into the undo stack. E.g. I edited the colors of a FixedMaterial but then when I did 'undo' the colors were left alone, and the previous things (translations, scales of meshes) were undone.

On the whole I think it is (a) unclear what will/not be available for 'undo'; (b) would be nice if everything were 'undo'able, or at least more than not.

data.title: Option to choose frames or seconds display in AnimationPlayer's timeline
data.body:
The timeline in AnimationPlayer, by default, shows the time in seconds, and the cursor snaps to the seconds subdivisions instead of individual frames.

![timeline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19820741/17646452/74534bf8-61a0-11e6-9297-1502568b8f66.png)

This is not good when importing an external animation made through frames reference (like importing from Blender), and when is needed to have more precision too. I suggest to add an option to toggle the individual frames display (changing the grid and snapping as well).

And a question: Godot have an animation frame rate parameter? Thanks.

data.title: SurfaceTool normals can't be smooth when UVs are added
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 beta and 2.1 stable, Windows 10 64 bits

When generating a surface with `SurfaceTool` and the `add_smooth_group(true)` method, it's impossible to get smooth normals if UVs are added to vertices.
I found that it specifically happens when UVs are not increasing from one vertice to another. So if every quad of a surface has UVs going from 0 to 1, the quad will be rendered with hard face normals.
Because of this I am forced to generate normals myself.

Not sure if it's a bug because I believe it was implemented so it does that. But as I said, it's possible to have smooth normals even in that case, so this can be enhanced.

Repro:
[SurfaceToolSmoothShading.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/416672/SurfaceToolSmoothShading.zip)
Launch the main scene, see the generated surface on the left with UVs has hard faces, the one on the right doesn't and has smooth faces, while both have a smooth group.

data.title: Theme colors not updating after upgrade to Godot 2.1
data.body:
This happens in my application in the editor (on Xubuntu 16.04 x86_64) and when running on Android 5.0 device.

In a panel script I fetch current theme using get_theme(), modify its colors and call set_theme() with the modified theme. Previously (in Godot 2.0) this changed colors in all child controls immediately. Now the new colors show only after the controls are "activated" (e.g. mouse-over on button or label text changes). 

I assume that setting the theme no longer causes redrawing of controls.

data.title: Can't find any way to set blendmode for Tiles
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any version on any OS so far

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
You can set materials and blendmodes on TileMap but they don't do anything.
You can also set Materials for individual Tiles of a TileSet but there seems to be no way to set their blendmode.

In theory you can work around this by using a material with a shader that uses screensample to do the custom blending in the fragment-shader but that doesn't work that well for some platforms, especially if want to have several TileMaps for multiple Layers.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- create scene with a TileMap and draw some Tiles in that Map
- change Material and/or blendmode on that TileMap -> no changes visible
- try to change the blendmode on the Tiles in the TileMaps TileSet where you can set the Material -> there is no such option

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
if needed I will upload one ... but it should be easy enough to reproduce already

data.title: Error running basic html5 build in chrome: "bad ioctl syscall 35090"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot_v2.1-stable_win64
Windows 8.1 64 bits
Google Chrome Versión 52.0.2743.116 and Firefox 48.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Game doesn't run in html5 because an error appears.
Error: web-build-2.html:265 abort("bad ioctl syscall 35090") at Error
Full stacktrace: http://pastebin.com/HgUvDSvU

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a basic scene with a TestCube, Camera and DirectionalLight
2. Compile to Html5 and copy contents to apache htdocs
3. Open url in Chrome or Firefox
4. Loading appears, then an error in the console

data.title: Add a Close All files option to script editor
data.body:
I got annoyed to have to close all opened scripts manually and added an option that closes all scripts and docs.

![bildschirmfoto von 2016-08-13 03-09-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311798/17640590/54fe35e4-6103-11e6-9079-7c099d471e3d.png)

It's not perfect though. When there are mulitple unsaved files, only the first triggers a dialog while the others remain open.

I also don't know why I get 
`ERROR: set_current_tab: Index p_current out of size (get_tab_count()).
   At: scene/gui/tab_container.cpp:453`

when closing more than 1 file, but it happens with Close Docs as well, so I don't think I'm at fault.

It's not compatible with 2.1, because ScriptTextEditor is now a ScriptEditorBase, but it's easily backported if needed.

data.title: Document lack of InputEvents with Input.action_press() and input.action_release()
data.body:
Mac OS X 10.11.6
Godot 2.1

Input.action_press() and Input.action_release() don't seem to do anything.

After a good chunk of trial and error I've simplified the code down to the following, attached to a global:

``` gdscript

extends Node

func _ready():
    set_process_input(true)
    print('trigger ui_accept')
    Input.action_press("ui_accept")

func _input(event):
    if event.is_action_pressed("ui_accept"):
        print('ui_accepted')
```

Which prints out:

```
trigger ui_accept
```

data.title: Compile error if target=release
data.body:

```
core\variant_call.cpp(1196): error C2039: 'arg_names': '_VariantCall::FuncData' is not member.
core\variant_call.cpp(1209): error C2039: 'return_type': '_VariantCall::FuncData' is not member.
core\variant_call.cpp(1211): error C2039: 'return_type': '_VariantCall::FuncData' is not member.
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
scons platform=windows tools=no **target=release**
scons platform=android tools=no **target=release**

data.title: HiDPI Screen option on Low DPI screen will break UI
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1, Godot 2.1 Stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I learned (tested) new functions and found HiDPI screens option. Turned it on, restart the engine and UI is now too big for my FHD screen (insane big). And godot not allowing me to resize the window big enough to get to the engine settings window. Even when I resize screen to a maximum width I see a half of UI.

Solved by resizing the window over and over again, once I got settings button in the top right corner somehow and got in the engine settings menu. But it is still a great problem.

**Steps to reproduce:**
In the description.

**Solution:**
- Make settings button always in the top right corner.
- Add some cancel button when HiDPI is setted up for the first time.
- Lock to auto/low DPI , when no 3K-4K displays found.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Asset store is ignoring zip files root folder
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.0 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I moved all my plugins into single repository and created zip files manually, inside zip I have folder structure like "addons/plugin_name/...".
It turned out that when users are downloading those plugins they are unziped in project root folder instead of addons.
The way how it works currently is probably dictated by the way how github creates archives. Archives from github have additional artificial root folder with repositor-commitHash name, and this is why assetlib is removing this directory.
I think there is need to recognize if archive is from github or not, guess simple check for root folder name would be enough (if it's named addons then no need to remove root folder).
Also I think  this can be solved with docs for now, but I in the future some recognition mechanism would be cool.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Ability for plugins to add entry under right mouse click context menu
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Yesterday I wrote a plugin which potentially solves https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4584 https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4584 (it allows you to extend scenes easily). 
The problem is there is no way to add an entry to right click mouse button context menu, so I needed to put new button near the editor 'settings' button, which is not elegant and take space all the time. Besides I can imagine there will be more plugins which allows to perform operations on nodes selected in scene tree tab... 

In context menu I think there should be  subcategory for each plugin which would automatically unfold when mouse cursor is near:
![subcategory](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/17616491/5950fb60-6075-11e6-8b68-e5c049d9a1cf.gif)
